title: James Comey Pleads Not Guilty to Lying to Congress, Trial Set for Jan 5
snippets: The former FBI director, who has long been one of President Trump's most vocal critics, was indicted last month on two counts stemming from his testimony before the Senate Judiciary Committee in September 2020.
Trump critic James Comey pleads not guilty to charges that he made false statements to Congress.
The former FBI director is accused of lying to Congress. Comey's defense team had said the charges brought on by Trump's justice department are politically motivated and should be thrown out.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMigwFBVV95cUxPcnZXUWR0bExjVmltdEE0LU1pd0pXWjBkV21uSkVfdXRIUHk4dE9jODBqemdmXzVOODNRSnppV2ZyeUZ0TC1mZkJkcXN6X0o0RVEyTHludnEtWTZmLW13S2RQdndCM1BlOHFiQlBncW0wMmMwSi1IMWUwb1RtV1J6N3RxTQ?oc=5" target="_blank">Comey pleads not guilty to charges from Trump's D
Former FBI Director James Comey pleaded not guilty on Wednesday. He is charged with one count of false statements and one count of obstruction of a congressional proceeding.
titles: Former FBI director Comey pleads not guilty to federal charges of lying to Congress
Trump live: Ex-FBI chief Comey pleads not guilty
Former-FBI director James Comey enters not guilty plea
Comey pleads not guilty to charges from Trump's DOJ - Axios
WATCH:  Ex-FBI Director James Comey pleads not guilty
summary: Former FBI Director James Comey, a critic of President Trump, pleaded not guilty to charges of making false statements to Congress during his 2020 testimony regarding the FBI's investigation into Russian election interference. His indictment and arraignment mark a significant development in what critics see as Trump's attempt to use the Justice Department against political adversaries. Comey's trial is scheduled for January 5. Reports suggest the case against Comey may lack strength.

title: Attack on Manchester Synagogue on Holy Day Kills Two; Assailant Claims IS Ties
snippets: Police confirm the attacker made the call after he crashed his car into a brick wall.
Police said Jihad al-Shamie called emergency services to declare allegiance to armed group as he carried out the attack.
Jihad al-Shamie, who attacked a Manchester synagogue on the holiest day of the Jewish calendar, called the emergency services during the attack to claim responsibility.

Police say Jihad al-Shamie made call to emergency services during attack that resulted in the deaths of two worshippers

The Manchester synagogue terrorist rang 999 during his deadly attack pledging allegiance to the terror group Islamic State, police have said.

Jihad al-Shamie, 35, ma
titles: Synagogue attacker pledged allegiance to 'Islamic State' in 999 call
Manchester synagogue attacker claimed allegiance to ISIS, UK police say
Manchester Synagogue Attacker Pledged Allegiance to ISIS, Police Say
Manchester synagogue terrorist pledged allegiance to Islamic State in 999 call
summary: Jihad al-Shamie attacked a Manchester synagogue on the Jewish calendar's holiest day, killing two worshippers. During the attack, he crashed his car into a brick wall, then called emergency services to claim responsibility and pledge allegiance to the Islamic State, according to police.

title: Joe Flacco Named Bengals' Starting QB for Week 6 Against Packers
snippets: The Bengals will start newly acquired quarterback Joe Flacco this Sunday against the Packers, coach Zac Taylor announced Wednesday.
Taylor went over the game plan with Flacco on the phone on his drive from Cleveland to Cincinnati
Recently acquired Bengals quarterback Joe Flacco will officially become the teams starter in Week 6 against the Green Bay Packers.

Joe Flacco to start against Packers: Bengals' Zac Taylor explains why veteran QB is best fit for Cincinnati
Recently traded Browns QB Joe Flacco will start for the Bengals in Week 6
summary: Joe Flacco has been named the starting quarterback for the Cincinnati Bengals in their Week 6 game against the Green Bay Packers, as announced by coach Zac Taylor. Flacco, who was recently acquired by the Bengals, discussed the game plan with Taylor while traveling from Cleveland to Cincinnati.

title: IRS Furloughs Workers Amid Ongoing Government Shutdown
snippets: The IRS furloughs came on the same day that the Senate again fell short of passing a funding resolution that would end the federal government shutdown.
The Senate failed Wednesday to approve spending plans to reopen the government.
Last week Trump said roughly 750,000 federal workers nationwide were expected to be furloughed across agencies, with some potentially fired.
titles: IRS furloughs nearly half of its workforce due to government shutdown
IRS Furloughs Nearly Half Of Its Staff Amid Government Shutdown
IRS to furlough almost half its workforce under contingency plan for government shutdown
summary: The IRS furloughed employees as the Senate failed to pass a funding resolution, continuing the federal government shutdown. Despite efforts, no spending plans were approved to reopen the government. President Trump previously stated that about 750,000 federal workers could be furloughed or fired due to the shutdown.

title: Man United Co-owner Backs Coach Amorim, Offers 3-Year Window to Prove Worth
snippets: Manchester United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe says manager Ruben Amorim needs three years to prove he is a "great" coach.

• Minority owner moves to clarify coach’s future

  • ‘You can’t run a club like United on kneejerk reactions’

Sir Jim Ratcliffe insists he will not take a “kneejerk” decision to sack Ruben Amorim and has indicated he will afford the head coach three years to demon
Manchester United minority owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe has said he wants to give under-pressure head coach Ruben Amorim three years in the job to prove himself.
titles: Amorim needs three years at Man Utd - Ratcliffe
Ratcliffe says Ruben Amorim has three years to prove himself at Manchester United
Ratcliffe: I want to give Amorim three years to prove himself at Man Utd
summary: Manchester United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe supports head coach Ruben Amorim, stating he will not make a "kneejerk" decision regarding his position. Ratcliffe emphasizes the importance of stability and has indicated Amorim will be given three years to demonstrate his capabilities and prove he is a "great" coach for the club.

title: Fed Officials Split on Rate Cuts Amid Inflation Concerns
snippets: Fed minutes show some officials cautious about recent rate cut&
Minutes from US central bank’s September meeting showed lingering concern about price pressures
New projections released showed Fed officials expected two additional quarter-point cuts by year’s end
titles: Fed minutes show some officials cautious about recent rate cut - Axios
Fed officials were cautious about inflation as they agreed rate cuts
Fed minutes show caution over inflation even as officials cut rates
summary: Minutes from the US Federal Reserve's September meeting revealed that some officials were hesitant about the recent decision to cut rates, due to ongoing concerns about inflation. Despite this, new projections indicated that the Fed anticipates two more quarter-point rate reductions by the end of the year.

title: Dolly Parton Debunks Health Rumors: "I Ain't Dead Yet!"

Country music star shares buoyant video on social media after rumors swirl about her health

Dolly Parton has taken to social media to clarify she “ain’t dead yet!”

In a
After her sister’s emotional post asking for prayers sparked concern, Dolly Parton set the record straight about her health in a new video. Here's what she said.
titles: Dolly Parton posts 'I ain't dead yet' after sister sparks health concerns
Dolly Parton addresses health concerns in new video: ‘I ain’t dead yet!’
Dolly Parton Breaks Silence Amid Health Concerns: ‘I’m Not Ready To Die Yet’
summary: Dolly Parton addressed health rumors by posting a video on social media, asserting "I ain't dead yet!" following concerns raised after her sister asked fans for prayers and Parton postponed gigs due to health issues. She aimed to clarify her current well-being to her fans.

title: California Wildfire Kills 12; Man Charged with Arson
snippets: The Palisades Fire in early January burned thousands of homes and killed multiple people as flames spread rapidly in heavy winds up to 100 miles per hour.

Jonathan Rinderknecht allegedly started blaze that destroyed over 6,800 structures in California

A 29-year-old man has been arrested and charged with igniting the fire that days later became the devastating Palisades blaze, which killed 12 people and destroyed more than 6,800 structures in
The complaint said the suspect, Jonathan Rinderknecht, asking a question to ChatGPT about lighting a cigarette in an effort to cover his tracks.
titles: Florida man charged with intentionally setting Pacific Palisades fire in LA
Man charged with starting Palisades fire that killed 12 people
29-year-old charged with starting the fire that destroyed LA’s Pacific Palisades
summary: In early January, the Palisades Fire in California, fueled by winds up to 100 mph, killed 12 people and destroyed over 6,800 structures. Jonathan Rinderknecht, 29, has been arrested and charged with starting the fire. He allegedly sought to cover his tracks by inquiring about lighting a cigarette.

title: EU Parliament Bans Meat Terms for Plant-Based Products Amid Criticism
snippets: Pressure to ban meat labels for plant-based products comes from Europe's livestock farmers.

Proponents say move would strengthen position of farmers in supply chain but critics dismiss it as ‘hotdog populism’

Veggie burgers, tofu steak and cauliflower schnitzel will be off the menu if the European parliament gets its way after a vote on food names.

MEPs voted on Wednesday by
More and more European shoppers are buying imitation schnitzel, bratwurst and steak made from plants but some politicians say only real meat should use those names.
titles: No more veggie burgers? EU parliament votes to ban meat names for plant-based foods
‘Veggie burgers’ could be off EU menu as MEPs back renaming plant-based foods
That’s no schnitzel! E.U. moves to ban using meat names for veggie fare.
summary: European Parliament voted to restrict plant-based products from using meat-related terms like 'burger' or 'steak'. This decision, supported by livestock farmers aiming to strengthen their market position, faces criticism for potentially misleading consumers and limiting choice. Critics label it as 'hotdog populism'. The outcome impacts labeling of plant-based foods across Europe, with opponents arguing it could confuse shoppers accustomed to such terms for vegetarian options.

title: Kemi Badenoch Pledges to Scrap Stamp Duty on Primary Homes to Cut Deficit
snippets: The Tory leader says the move would help millions buy a home, in her annual conference speech.
Leader pitches Conservatives as party of spending control with promise to drive down Britain’s deficit

Leader announces tax cut plan for England and Northern Ireland in speech aimed at boosting fiscal credibility

The Conservatives will scrap stamp duty on sales of primary residences if they win the next election, Kemi Badenoch has said, in a policy-heavy speech designed to improve her standi
titles: Conservatives would scrap stamp duty on main homes, Badenoch says
Badenoch vows to scrap stamp duty
Tories will scrap stamp duty on primary residences, Kemi Badenoch tells conference
summary: The Conservative Party leader, Kemi Badenoch, has promised to eliminate stamp duty on sales of primary residences to reduce Britain's deficit and boost the party's fiscal reputation. This policy, aimed at freeing up the housing market and enhancing social mobility, was announced in a speech focusing on fiscal responsibility. Concurrently, the Labour deputy leadership election begins, with Lucy Powell viewed as the frontrunner.

title: Rangers to Discuss Managerial Role with Steven Gerrard in London

Steven Gerrard will meet Rangers' owners in London over the coming days to hold talks over a sensational return to Ibrox.

Gerrard set to hold talks with Rangers owners in London
summary: Rangers are set to discuss their managerial vacancy with Steven Gerrard this week. Gerrard is scheduled to meet the team's owners in London in the coming days to talk about a potential return to Ibrox.

title: Nathan Lukes to Play Left Field, Bat Second in ALDS Game 4 for Blue Jays
snippets: Nathan Lukes will play in left field and bat second for the Toronto Blue Jays in Game 4 of their American League Division Series against New York.

An oddly poor night in the field cost the Blue Jays in Game 3 against the Yankees. It may be more blip than trend, but either way, the defence must be rectified immediately if Toronto wants to advance.
Chess moves for Game 4 of the ALDS have already begun.
titles: Lukes back in lineup for Blue Jays in Game 4
Blue Jays must tighten up defence ahead of Game 4
Yankees roll out balanced lineup for Game 4 against Blue Jays
summary: Nathan Lukes is set to play left field and bat second for the Toronto Blue Jays in Game 4 of the American League Division Series (ALDS) against New York. Following a disappointing performance in the field during Game 3, which contributed to a loss against the Yankees, the Blue Jays are making strategic adjustments. The team aims to improve its defense to secure a win in the upcoming game and advance in the series.

title: BOLO Program Updates Canada's Top 25 Most Wanted; Rewards Offered
snippets: A new list of Canada's 25 most wanted fugitives includes 14 suspects wanted by Ontario police agencies, with others sought by authorities in Manitoba, Quebec, B.C. and Alberta.
Three Winnipeggers have the dubious honour of appearing on the latest Top 25 Most Wanted List from the nationwide BOLO Program, police say.

Two of the top 25 most wanted people across Canada are charged by Ottawa police with murder. The Bolo program shared an updated list of Canada’s top 25 most wanted fugitives on Wednesday, and investigators are offering financial rewards to anyone with information about their whereabouts. Topping the
titles: Canada’s top 25 most wanted includes 17 who face murder charges
‘On the lookout’: 3 Winnipeggers in Canada’s top 25 most wanted list
Two fugitives charged by Ottawa police still on top 25 most wanted list
summary: The BOLO Program has updated its list of Canada's top 25 most wanted fugitives, featuring 14 suspects from Ontario and others from Manitoba, Quebec, B.C., and Alberta. This list includes three individuals from Winnipeg and two charged with murder by Ottawa police. Authorities are offering financial rewards for information leading to the apprehension of these fugitives.

title: Flight Delays Rise Amid Controller Shortage and Government Shutdown
snippets: Flight delays and cancellations are climbing as sick calls involving air traffic controllers leave a number of airport towers and control facilities without enough staff to handle all flights.
The government shutdown is exacerbating concerns about the strain on air traffic controllers, a shortage of whom has vexed airline executives for years.
titles: WATCH:  Air traffic controller shortages amid shutdown lead to canceled flights, delays
Air traffic control shortages add to U.S. flight delays, FAA says
summary: Flight delays and cancellations are increasing due to a shortage of air traffic controllers caused by sickness-related absences. The ongoing government shutdown is worsening the situation, highlighting a long-standing issue of controller shortages that has troubled airline executives for years.

title: Jon Rahm Leads Europe to Ryder Cup Victory, Shines in Spain Return
snippets: Rahm was dominant helping lead Europe to a relatively dominant win over the United States
Jon Rahm is back in action at his home tournament in Spain following what he considered the "toughest week mentally" of his career during the Ryder Cup in New York.

Rahm returns to home event after 'toughest week' of career at Ryder Cup

Following this, Rahm returned to compete in his home tournament in Spain, demonstrating his resilience and skill on the golf course.

title: U.S. Government Shutdown Begins Amid Funding Deal Stalemate
snippets: President Donald Trump and Republicans accuse Democrats, who want any funding bill to include health-care protections, of holding the government hostage.
The government shutdown began at midnight on Oct. 1 as Democrats and Republicans appeared to be nowhere close to reaching a funding deal.
titles: Senate again rejects funding bills as government shutdown enters second week
Government Shutdown: Senate Blocks Bills To Reopen Government
summary: The U.S. government shutdown began at midnight on October 1, following a failure to reach a funding deal, with Democrats demanding health-care protections in any bill and Republicans, led by President Donald Trump, accusing them of holding the government hostage.

title: Germany Extends Citizenship Waiting Period from 3 to 5 Years
snippets: Crossing fast-track citizenship off the books was a key migration-related election campaign promise from Chancellor Merz's CDU. Critics argue that this will deter highly qualified immigrants from coming to Germany.

Friedrich Merz’s conservatives had pledged to rescind legislation, which allowed citizenship in three years instead of five

Germany’s parliament has rescinded a fast-track citizenship programme, reflecting the rapidly shifting mood on migration in Europe’s labour-hungry economic powerhouse.
titles: German parliament votes to get rid of fast-track citizenship
Germany ends fast-track citizenship as mood on migration shifts
summary: Germany's parliament has repealed a program that enabled fast-track citizenship, changing the waiting period from three to five years. This move fulfills a campaign promise of Chancellor Friedrich Merz's CDU party, amid concerns that it may discourage highly skilled immigrants from moving to Germany. The decision reflects a changing attitude towards migration in the country.

title: High-Level Officials Join Israel-Hamas Talks in Egypt, Boosting Peace Hopes
snippets:
US Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff, Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner, Qatar’s PM and Turkey’s intelligence chief gather in Egypt

US, Qatari and Turkish officials joined the third day of indirect negotiations between Israel and Hamas in Egypt, as cautious optimism grew that a lasting truce t

CAIRO (AP) — The United States’ top Middle East adviser, the prime minister of Qatar and other senior officials joined the third day of peace talks between Israel and Hamas in an Egyptian resort on Wednesday, a sign that negotiators aim to dive deeply into the toughest issues of an American pl
titles: Optimism grows for Gaza peace deal as top US, Qatari and Turkish officials join talks
Top officials from US and Qatar join talks aimed at brokering peace in Gaza
summary: US Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff, Jared Kushner, Qatar's PM, and Turkey's intelligence chief attended the third day of indirect Israel-Hamas peace talks in Egypt. With senior officials from the US, Qatar, and Turkey joining, there's cautious optimism for a lasting truce. This high-level involvement indicates a deep dive into resolving critical issues.

title: Lecornu Resigns 14 Hours After Cabinet Announcement, Lowers Election Odds
snippets: Lecornu resigned on Monday only 14 hours after naming his Cabinet, which had met resistance from rival political parties.
Sébastien Lecornu says prospect of a snap parliamentary election is receding
titles: France: Lecornu says there could be new PM in 48 hours
Macron could name a new French PM in next 48 hours, says outgoing premier
summary: Sébastien Lecornu resigned as a minister 14 hours after announcing his Cabinet, facing opposition from rival parties. Following his resignation, Lecornu stated that the likelihood of a snap parliamentary election is decreasing.

title: Amazon and Walmart Compete with Major Discounts in October Sales Event
snippets: Amazon is the retailer to beat when it comes to offering deals that compete with Amazon’s October Prime Day event. Updated deals on keyboards, laptops, chargers, cameras, and lots of other stuff!

Concurrently, Walmart is competing by matching several of Amazon's discounts and offering additional deals on tech products.

title: Israeli Military Stops Flotilla Trying to Break Gaza Blockade, Detains Activists
snippets:
New group of vessels intercepted in international waters while at least seven people from previous flotilla still held

A Gaza-bound humanitarian flotilla aimed at breaking Israel’s naval blockade has been intercepted by the Israeli military, days after the detention of activists on an earli
It was the second attempt in as many weeks to breach the restrictions around the Gaza Strip. Neither has succeeded.
titles: Israel halts another Gaza aid flotilla as MEPs demand activists’ release
Israel Intercepts Another Activist Flotilla Aiming to Break Gaza Blockade
summary: The Israeli military intercepted a nine-boat flotilla attempting to break Israel's naval blockade of Gaza in the Mediterranean Sea, detaining scores of activists. This incident marks the second unsuccessful attempt in recent weeks to breach the blockade, with at least seven activists from a previous flotilla still being held.

title: Julia Wandelt on Trial for Alleged Harassment of McCann Family

Kate McCann has said it was hard to hear an alleged stalker refer to her as “Mum”, as she gave evidence in the trial of a woman who claimed to be her missing daughter.

Speak
titles: Kate McCann tells court alleged stalker's contact with Maddie's sister was 'final straw'
Kate McCann tells court of stress caused by alleged stalker calling her ‘Mum’
summary: Julia Wandelt is on trial for allegedly harassing the McCann family for over two years, including sending a letter signed with their missing daughter's name. Kate McCann testified, finding it difficult to hear Wandelt call her "Mum."

title: 2025 Nobel in Chemistry for Pioneers of Pollution-Fighting Frameworks
snippets: The work that won Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar M. Yaghi the 2025 Nobel Prize in chemistry could help tackle challenges such as climate change and lack of fresh water.
Three researchers share prize for structured polymers called metal-organic frameworks.
titles: Trio wins chemistry Nobel Prize for metal organic framework
Chemistry Nobel prize awarded for building ordered polymers with metal
summary: Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, and Omar M. Yaghi were awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for their development of metal–organic frameworks. These structures are capable of capturing carbon dioxide, storing toxic gases, catalyzing chemical reactions, and harvesting water from desert air. Their groundbreaking work offers potential solutions to global challenges like climate change and water scarcity.

title: 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry Awarded for Crystal Discovery
snippets: The winners of the prestigious science prize were announced by the Nobel committee in Sweden.
Three scientists have been awarded the 2025 Nobel prize in chemistry for discovering a new form of molecular architecture: crystals that contain large cavities.
titles: Chemistry Nobel goes to work on new materials that could help planet
Nobel chemistry prize awarded for crystal materials that could revolutionize green technology
summary: The Nobel committee in Sweden announced that three scientists won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for their discovery of a new molecular architecture: crystals with large cavities.
